Test definition: Characterizes the federated data topology and distributional heterogeneity on C-MAPSS, evidencing a realistic client landscape with representative ODD coverage and clean evaluation preconditions for assurance.
Justification: Provides foundational validity of the FL testbed by aligning client heterogeneity and ODD representativeness with assurance expectations including auditability of pre-processing and feature engineering steps.

Test definition: Assesses model generalization and statistical certainty by contrasting train/test behavior and quantifying confidence interval widths across centralized and federated settings; includes biasï¿½variance trade-off analysis.

Test definition: Evaluates safety-critical fault detection within a defined decision horizon using safety-linked acceptance thresholds, complemented by discrimination indicators.
Justification: Establishes safety-causal acceptance for detection performance while preserving comparability through common discriminative metrics.
Metrics evaluated: M.SAF.ACC; M.SAF.REC; M.SAF.FPFN; M.SAF.FNR_MAX; M.SAF.FPR_MAX; M.CLS.Pre; M.CLS.F1_Sc; M.CLS.AUC

Test definition: Evaluates remaining useful life estimation fidelity under safety constraints, capturing asymmetric timeliness costs via a domain-standard prognostics score alongside RMSE.
Justification: Demonstrates prognostic adequacy for maintenance decision-making under safety-linked limits.

Test definition: Assesses stability of performance across clients and operating regimes, emphasizing worst-group behavior to expose harmful disparities.
Justification: Ensures equitable and safe performance across federated participants by highlighting extreme underperformance and confirming transformations do not induce harmful drift.

Test definition: Quantifies the equity of federated learning benefits by comparing client-level gains against a suitable baseline across the federation.
Justification: Confirms that FL improves outcomes broadly rather than privileging specific clients or regimes.

Test name: Robustness to ODD Segment Shifts & Perturbations
Test definition: Assesses resilience to operational domain variation and realistic input imperfections by measuring controlled degradation across ODD segments and perturbations.
Justification: Demonstrates dependable behavior under plausible variations expected in aviation maintenance contexts; includes per-client inference stability.

Test definition: Evaluates readiness for distributional drift through detection timeliness, sensitivity, and statistical signal strength under representative shift scenarios.
Justification: Supports lifecycle assurance by showing effective discovery of performance-degrading shifts.

Test definition: Assesses communication feasibility under bandwidth constraints by characterizing payload budgets and efficiency gains from compression or sparsification.
Justification: Aligns FL training practicality with edge/airborne communication limitations.

Test definition: Benchmarks the optimization efficiency of federated algorithms via convergence speed and resource cadence under matched budgets and tuning.
Justification: Enables method selection based on efficiency and timeliness for operational constraints.

Test definition: Characterizes the privacy-utility balance by reporting achieved differential privacy budgets together with performance impacts relative to non-private baselines.
Justification: Provides explicit accountability for privacy protection under regulatory expectations.

Test definition: Assesses robustness to malicious or faulty participants by jointly measuring attack success, tolerance of robust aggregation, and server-side detection effectiveness.
Justification: Maintains integrity of federated training in adversarial conditions relevant to aviation maintenance networks.

Test definition: Profiles runtime viability on representative hardware through latency characteristics pertinent to deployment contexts.
Justification: Ensures real-time and resource feasibility for edge or airborne deployment targets primarily via inference latency.

Test definition: Assesses explanation quality without human studies by quantifying attribution fidelity to model behavior and stability across clients and perturbations.
Justification: Delivers quantitative explainability evidence compatible with automated benchmarking constraints.
